info.description: A RESTful API service for chat functionality
info.title: Notify Chat Service API

post.description: Authenticate user with email and password

200.description: Login successful - returns JWT token and user data

post.description: Register a new user with username, email, and password

get.description: Get all channels that the current user is a member of, separated by type

200.description: Object with direct and group channel lists

post.description: Create a new channel with the specified name

get.description: Get detailed information about a specific channel

put.description: Update the name of an existing channel

delete.description: Delete a channel (only channel owner can delete)

put.description: Remove the current user from a channel

post.description: Add a user to a channel (only channel owner can add users)

delete.description: Remove a user from a channel (only channel owner can remove users)

get.description: Get all chat messages for a specific channel (paginated)
get.summary: Get chat messages in a channel

get.description: Get the current user's profile information

Establish a WebSocket connection for real-time messaging with typed message support.

## Message Types
The WebSocket API uses typed messages with the following enum values:

### Connection Events
- `connection.connect` - Connection established (server -> client)
- `connection.disconnect` - Connection closed (server -> client)
- `connection.ping` - Ping message (client -> server)
- `connection.pong` - Pong response (server -> client)

### Channel Events
- `channel.join` - Join a channel (client -> server)
- `channel.leave` - Leave a channel (client -> server)
- `channel.message` - Send/receive channel message (bidirectional)
- `channel.typing` - Typing indicator (client -> server)
- `channel.stop_typing` - Stop typing indicator (client -> server)

### Channel Member Events
- `channel.member.join` - Member joined channel (server -> client)
- `channel.member.leave` - Member left channel (server -> client)

### User Events
- `user.status` - User status update (server -> client)
- `user.notification` - User notification (server -> client)

### Error Events
- `error` - Error message (server -> client)

## Message Format
All messages follow this JSON structure:
```json
{
"id": "unique-message-id",
"type": "message-type-enum",
"data": { /* type-specific data */ },
"timestamp": 1234567890,
"user_id": "user-id"
}
```

## Example Messages

### Join Channel
```json
{
"id": "msg-123",
"type": "channel.join",
"data": { "channel_id": "channel-123" },
"timestamp": 1234567890,
"user_id": "user-456"
}
```

### Send Message
```json
{
"id": "msg-456",
"type": "channel.message",
"data": {
"channel_id": "channel-123",
"text": "Hello world!",
"url": null,
"fileName": null
},
"timestamp": 1234567890,
"user_id": "user-456"
}
```

### Error Response
```json
{
"id": "error-789",
"type": "error",
"data": {
"code": "INVALID_MESSAGE",
"message": "Invalid message format"
},
"timestamp": 1234567890,
"user_id": "user-456"
}
```

400.description: Bad request - missing or invalid userId parameter

get.description: Returns the enum values for all valid WebSocket message types

Returns the schemas for all WebSocket message types used in the real-time messaging API.
This endpoint is for documentation purposes only and provides TypeScript-compatible schemas.

## Available Message Types:
- **connection.connect** - Connection established (server -> client)
- **connection.disconnect** - Connection closed (server -> client)
- **connection.ping** - Ping message (client -> server)
- **connection.pong** - Pong response (server -> client)
- **channel.join** - Join a channel (client -> server)
- **channel.leave** - Leave a channel (client -> server)
- **channel.message** - Send/receive channel message (bidirectional)
- **channel.typing** - Typing indicator (client -> server)
- **channel.stop_typing** - Stop typing indicator (client -> server)
- **channel.member.join** - Member joined channel (server -> client)
- **channel.member.leave** - Member left channel (server -> client)
- **user.status** - User status update (server -> client)
- **user.notification** - User notification (server -> client)
- **error** - Error message (server -> client)
Returns the schema for channel message data structure
Returns the schema for error data structure
Returns the schema for typing indicator data structure

BearerAuth.description: Type "Bearer" followed by a space and JWT token.
BearerAuth.name: Authorization

members.description: List of members in the channel

chat-service_internal_models.ChannelMess.description: Data structure for channel.message message type

channel_id.description: ID of the channel where message is sent

reply_to_id.description: Optional ID of message being replied to

createdAt.description: timestamp of when the message was created

senderId.description: ID of the user who sent the message

chat-service_internal_models.ErrorData.description: Data structure for error message type

chat-service_internal_models.TypingIndic.description: Data structure for channel.typing and channel.stop_typing message types

channel_id.description: ID of the channel where typing is happening

avatar.description:
Avatar is optional and can be used to store a profile picture URL
It is not mandatory for the user to have an avatar.

chat-service_internal_models.WebSocketEx.description: Example WebSocket messages for different message types

chat-service_internal_models.WebSocketMe.description: Base WebSocket message structure that all messages follow

data.description: Message payload data - structure depends on message type

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp when message was created

type.description: Message type enum - see WebSocketMessageType for valid values

user_id.description: ID of the user who sent the message

valid.description: Valid is true if Time is not NULL
